title: cmd/gc: racewalk: false positive on empty structs
body:
14937:f2755950769b tip

package main

type Empty struct {}

type X struct {
	y int64
	Empty
}

type Y struct {
	x X
	y int64
}

func main() {
	c := make(chan X)
	var y Y
	go func() {
		x := y.x  // line 19
		c <- x
	}()
	y.y = 42  // line 22
	<-c
}

go run -race says:

WARNING: DATA RACE
Read by goroutine 2:
  main.funcÂ·001()
      /tmp/race.go:19 +0x46

Previous write by goroutine 0:
  main.main()
      /tmp/race.go:22 +0xd0

This is caused by the fact that racewalk emits the following code for "x :=
y.x"
raceread(&y.x.y)
raceread(&y.x.Empty)
The Empty field is physically non-existent, but it's "address" equals to
address of &y.y.

Racewalk must not emit read of &y.x.Empty at all.
